Name: The Best Audience
Description: Lorenzo from Egla Town seems in need of help.
QuestDesc: Lorenzo from Egla Town seems in need of help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, {PlayerName}! What wind blows you here today?

Options.PlotLineKey: And what wind blows you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Egla Town is where I grew up. I always come back during the troupe's off-seasons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this time, I've invited someone special to join me. Chalulu, go ahead and say hello to {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chalulu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eeya—ha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chalulu really seems to fancy you, {PlayerName}. You must have a charm that speaks to Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chalulu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eeya—eeya!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Easy there, easy. Seems like she can't wait to share her new discoveries with you. Look—

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are more of them, and they aren't just any graffiti. I can feel a unique frequency lingering on them, likely from an Echo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chalulu seems to be fascinated by the graffiti, her eyes studying every mark with an intense curiosity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anyone tries to clean up the graffiti, Chalulu will dash over to stop them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chalulu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ooh-la ooh-la ooh-la—ya-ha!

Options.PlotLineKey: I never knew Echoes could paint.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For Echoes with a strong urge to express themselves, graffiti might just be the easiest way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The question is, what is this kid trying to express? Makes you wonder, doesn't it?

Options.PlotLineKey: Kid... that's an unusual way to put it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, excuse me! Let's call this one "Painter" then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of Echoes, your connection with them is truly something else. You probably understand their "thoughts" better than I ever could.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could you photograph the artworks by Painter before they get wiped off? We might find something intriguing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A sparkling eye... with a sword at its center?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sword must mean something important to Painter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the sparkling eye might be a symbol of hope, or admiration.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A moon and a sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one seems to be depicting the "Night Reveries" of Egla Town.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At night, the villagers lock themselves away, while the knight Tacet Discord rises, sword in hand, under the pale moonlight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A knight's mask and swords on one side, a black mask and brushes on the other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The knight is the only hero in the story, and the black mask likely stands for the side characters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd bet three Pizza Classica that the black mask symbolizes the evil giant's underling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A knight's mask, with crossing brush and sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to mean a face-off. The knight has to defeat the underling before the final battle with the giant.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Painter"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chalulu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ooh-la ooh-la! Eeya-ha—gulululululu!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Chalulu seems to have explained your intentions, and the Cuddle Wuddle waves its hands bashfully.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorenzo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "A villain is never a shadow on stage; it's the spotlight cast upon the hero." Your performance as the villain was brilliant, dear Painter.

Options.PlotLineKey: You were fantastic in your role!
I'd be honored to be your audience.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Painter"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm—mmm mmm mmm mmm!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Painter flushes, then rummages through a tear in his body, looking for something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Suddenly, he pauses, as if he has found what he sought. He clenches the item tightly in his palm, carefully extending it toward you—

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In his hand lies a flattened piece of candy, possibly a Carnevale giveaway. He tries, awkwardly, to speak like a human—

Dialogues.Speaker: "Painter"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Th-th (Thank), guh (you), ee-eh (very), muh (much).
